jobDescription:
I f you are passionate about Administration and highly motivated in developing your reception experience coming from a corporate, leisure or hospitality environment then this role is exactly what you was looking for.

In the role of Client Centre Receptionist you will manage the Reception Desk within working hours, adhering to the opening and closing procedures. You will b e the first point of contact for general enquiries, managing calls and emails in a timely manner. You will have an opportunity to add value providing professional support to other teams and departments.

Job responsibilities
  • Managing the welcome process and registration of visitors and clients according to security procedures
  • Answer incoming calls , returning all voicemails and action all e-mails as quickly as possible.
  • Planning such events and meetings that are allocated by the different stakeholders across all lines of business, from reservations stage to billing stage. Review details of each allocated event/meeting for the coming day at the daily function meeting.
  • Provide accurate and appropriate information at all times, seeking specialist support where necessary.
  • Ensuring EMS information is always up to date
  • Ensure that adequate supplies of stationery and sundries are available for the Reception Desk and request new orders when required.

Required qualifications, capabilities and skills
  • Client-facing experience
  • Strong interpersonal skills, team player
  • Highly organized; ability to handle multiple tasks and apply judgment to prioritize
  • Strong Computer skills (MS Office; Room Booking System e.g. EMS)
  • Flexibility to deal with a fast-paced, diverse environment
  • Excellent communication skills in German and in English; both oral and written
  • Work comfortably under pressure and observe deadlines

We offer
  • Supportive environment to combine work and family requirements: flexible work arrangements, plus special support for working parents in emergency situations with free emergency childcare services and our very own parent-child office
  • Financial stability: competitive salaries, pension provisions via the BVV and our very own pension plan as well as an accident insurance
  • Personal wellbeing: a range of offers available, from on-site medical checks and vaccinations to educational sessions and a subsidized in-house canteen, plus the option to increase your vacation entitlement to more than the standard 30 days pa.
  • Create a workspace where you can be yourself: you can get involved in our local philanthropic agenda, join employee networking groups and the JPM Club for social activities.
  • Build your career: benefit from our bespoke mentoring program and a broad range of learning and development offerings

J.P. Morgan is a global leader in financial services, providing strategic advice and products to the world's most prominent corporations, governments, wealthy individuals and institutional investors. Our first-class business in a first-class way approach to serving clients drives everything we do. We strive to build trusted, long-term partnerships to help our clients achieve their business objectives.

We recognize that our people are our strength and the diverse talents they bring to our global workforce are directly linked to our success. We are an equal opportunity employer and place a high value on diversity and inclusion at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of any protected attribute, including race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, age, marital or veteran status, pregnancy or disability, or any other basis protected under applicable law. In accordance with applicable law, we make reasonable accommodations for applicants' and employees' religious practices and beliefs, as well as any mental health or physical disability needs.

We are looking for a Kitchen-staff / dishwasher in fulltime (m/f/d) for our catering company in Bremen You will be responsible for
  • Clean and sanitize food preparation work stations
  • Assist in the food preparation process by cutting, chopping, slicing, and washing vegetables, meats, and other ingredients
  • cleaning the plates, cutlery, pots and pans and ensure order and cleanliness in the kitchen and restaurant
  • Follow all food health and safety requirements
  • Assist with the unloading of deliveries and their proper storage
  • Interact with customers as needed
Having experience working in similar jobs would be nice. what we expect: diligence, basic knowledge in English or German, reliability what we offer: special payments, free lunch & beverages, regular working time (Monday till Friday by day, no work on the weekend) Interested? Send us your application!

Become an over-the-phone interpreter and join the thousands already part of the Telelanguage team. Work from home and assist millions of LEP (Limited English Proficiency) needing language service across the globe. Work alongside doctors, nurses, physicians, therapists and millions of providers across the globe. Requirements Fluent in English and one (1) or more language with both oral and written skills A year experience as an interpreter (reviewed on case by case basis) Medical training (reviewed on case by case basis) A secure and reliable phone line to take calls Quiet environment to take calls (personal office) Benefits: Choose your own schedule Flexibility Enhance your linguistic skills and vocabulary Earn money on your own terms

What your role will be

  • You work closely with our Communications & Content team to develop various types of content, including our app, social, and blog articles highlighting our collectibles and teaser texts
  • You research and identify content needs and create engaging communication material on topics such as alternative investments, collectibles, blockchain etc.
  • You work closely with our Assets & Collectibles Management team to unravel the most interesting facts about the collectibles in our portfolio and develop content that will motivate users to invest with Timeless

What we want to see in you

  • You are enrolled as a student in the fields of Journalism, Linguistics, Communications/Media Science, Marketing or something similar
  • You have exceptional writing and editing skills in native-level English, some knowledge of German is a plus
  • You are interested in creating and managing a content calendar, as well as learning about how to adopt a versatile writing style to address different audiences
  • You understand the importance of UX when writing for digital products, and can help us prepare copy that is compelling, concise and friendly
  • You have a hands-on attitude, are creative and thrive in a start-up environment
  • You are ideally interested in the market of collectibles, alternative investments, blockchain and financial topics

What you can expect from us

  • Team spirit: No divas and flat hierarchies!
  • Grow together: We are growing and you will grow with us! How? With a challenging environment and an international team that will support you in everything
  • The #newnormal: flexible working hours and a hybrid (or full-time) remote work setup that can be adapted to your personal needs!
  • Remote support: initiatives to support you working remotely, including providing you with what you need to improve your home office environment, as well as weekly team games
  • Startup perks: Regular virtual team events and surprise packages delivered straight to your address

About us

Timeless is a platform where you can buy limited shares of exclusive assets, such as rare sneakers, watches, NFTs and luxury cars, and profit from their performance. Help us grow and develop this great product for the 21st century. Invest in #thingsyoulove

Ready to lead, disrupt and reinvent the sleep industry?

We are Emma – The Sleep Company. Created in 2013, we are now the world's largest D2C sleep brand, available in over 30 countries and recommended by many consumer associations in EMEA, APAC, and the Americas. We're pushing the boundaries of technology to transform the world of sleep and we want your help to pull it off.
We're a highly ambitious, hard-working team that pushes you to produce your best work yet. We focus on how we approach problems, we chase growth, and set ambitious goals. Want your ideas to have an impact and your career to grow? Then Emma is the right place for you.

This is what you'll do:

  • You help us shape Emma's marketing strategy globally in order to establish Emma as the leading sleep brand
  • You are responsible for the best possible implementation of this brand at the individual touchpoints of the customer journey
  • Accordingly, you work on a wide range of marketing related topics from communication to CRM and brand-related topics, sharpening Emma's brand image
  • You are responsible for managing internal and external stakeholders
  • You interact with the global teams as well as the country teams on a daily basis and support marketing and PR managers with e.g. expanding the Emma e-commerce shop, developing the affiliation and/or offline marketing strategy
  • You develop KPIs and track the success of the marketing measures
  • Additional fields that you could work in would be product/retail marketing as well as influencer marketing

This is what you'll bring to us:

  • You have finished or are currently pursuing a Degree in Business Administration, Marketing, Economics or have an equivalent form of education
  • Proactive and initiative mindset, with a knowledge-hungry core
  • You are enthusiastic about marketing, your strengths include communication, team spirit and a sense of responsibility
  • You think outside the box and are solution oriented
  • You make rational decisions by analyzing and monitoring data turning insights in to actionable tactics
  • You’re a self-sufficient team player that is goal-oriented, structured, pragmatic, and has a flare for risk
  • You are fluent in English
  • You are proficient in the use of the MS Office package
  • You are available for at least 4-6 months

This is what we offer:

  • Responsibility and decision-making authority from your first day
  • The opportunity to work on challenging tasks that contribute to your professional growth
  • Work independently and as part of a dedicated, international team
  • The opportunity to help shape our company culture
  • Make an impact initiating new ideas
  • Work with and learn from experts in diverse fields
  • Get to know your team members at our exciting company events
  • Competitive salary of 1750€ per month for internships longer than 3 months
Become an Emmie

Emma is transforming the world of sleep - and we want the highest-performing people to help us pull it off. We want you. But only if you're willing to go all in. Only if you're willing to question, disrupt, innovate, and create from the ground up.

We proudly celebrate diversity. We are an equal-opportunity employer committed to promoting inclusion in our workplace. We consider all qualified applicants for employment without regard to race, ethnic origin, religion or belief, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, disability, or age.

Our aim is to get back to you in a couple of days, however, we are currently receiving a large number of applications and this might lead to a delay in the process. We will get back to you as soon as possible!

We are looking for salespeople to join our team as soon as possible in Cologne, Germany!

As a salesperson for one of our many non-profit clients, you'll get involved with your teammates on various great projects. You are the face of our clients. You inform interested parties about the respective project and convince them to become permanent donors like so many others. Thanks to your motivational skills and social competence, every conversation ends with great satisfaction for both parties.

Qualifications:

  • You have strong communication and social skills.
  • You are at least 18 years old.
  • You are available at least two days per week.
  • English speaker.

Why Direct Result?

  • An attractive salary + bonuses and commissions.
  • Flexible working hours.
  • Promotion and development opportunities.
  • Cool parties and events.

If we grabbed your interest, contact me through Whatsapp: +4917668891134 ; or Email: Shady@direct-result.de.

Type of position: Full-time, Part-time, or Working student.

Hiring Path:
  • Open to the public
Who May Apply/Clarification From the Agency:
For USEFM - FP is 7. Actual FP salary determined by Washington D.C.

  • All Interested Applicants / All Sources

Security Clearance Required:
Public Trust - Background Investigation
Appointment Type
Permanent
Appointment Type Details:
Indefinite subject to successful completion of a 6-month probationary period.
Marketing Statement:

We encourage you to read and understand the Eight (8) Qualities of Overseas Employees before you apply.

Summary:

The work schedule for this position is:


  • Full Time (40 hours per week)


Start date: Candidate must be able to begin working within a reasonable period of time of receipt of agency authorization and/or clearances/certifications or their candidacy may end.

Supervisory Position:
No
Relocation Expenses Reimbursed:
No
Travel Required:
Not Required

Duties

As a Visa Assistant in the Visa Unit, the incumbent performs a broad range of work in connection with the acceptance and processing of all types of visa applications (both immigrant (IV) and nonimmigrant (NIV)) at a post with a heavy demand for such services. Applications are often complex, and many are submitted by third country nationals (TCNs). Frankfurt is a unique post with applicants coming from over 160 different nationalities. The large TCN pool complicates processing due to diverse and unfamiliar documents and increased fraud ramifications. Incumbent will be assigned to IV and NIV work tasks as needed.


Qualifications and Evaluations

Requirements:

EXPERIENCE:


  • Two (2) years of general office experience in which the application of regulatory material and contact with the public is required, or one (1) year of immigrant visa experience.


Education Requirements:

Completion of Secondary School or Local Mandatory Schooling and received high school diploma is required.


Evaluations:

LANGUAGE:


  • English (fluent): speaking/reading/writing, may include the ability to translate.

  • German (fluent): speaking/reading/writing, may include the ability to translate.


This may be tested.


EQUAL EMPLOYMENT OPPORTUNITY (EEO): The U.S. Mission provides equal opportunity and fair and equitable treatment in employment to all people without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, age, disability, political affiliation, marital status, or sexual orientation.

Qualifications:

All applicants under consideration will be required to pass medical and security certifications.


Benefits and Other Info

Benefits URL:
Review our Benefits
Agency Benefits:

Locally Employed Staff, including Members of Household (MOHs), and Third-Country Nationals (TCNs), working at the U.S. Mission in Germany may receive a compensation package that may include health, separation, and other benefits.


For EFMs, benefits should be discussed with the Human Resources Office.


The pay plan is assigned at the time of the conditional offer letter by the HR Office.

Other Information:

For the current COVID-19 Requirements please visit the following link.


HIRING PREFERENCE SELECTION PROCESS: Applicants in the following hiring preference categories are extended a hiring preference in the order listed below. Therefore, it is essential that these applicants accurately describe their status on the application. Failure to do so may result in a determination that the applicant is not eligible for a hiring preference.


HIRING PREFERENCE ORDER:
1. AEFM / USEFM who is a preference-eligible U.S. Veteran*
2. AEFM / USEFM
3. FS on LWOP and CS with reemployment rights **


  • IMPORTANT: Applicants who claim status as a preference-eligible U.S. Veteran must submit a copy of their most recent DD-214 (“Certificate of Release or Discharge from Active Duty”), Letter from Veterans’ Affairs which indicates the present existence of a service-connected disability dated within the past six months, equivalent documentation, or certification. A “certification” is any written document from the armed forces that certifies the service member is expected to be discharged or released from active duty service in the armed forces under honorable conditions within 120 days after the certification is submitted by the applicant. The certification letter should be on letterhead of the appropriate military branch of the service and contain (1) the military service dates including the expected discharge or release date; and (2) the character of service. Acceptable documentation must be submitted in order for the preference to be given.


** This level of preference applies to all Foreign Service employees on LWOP and CS with re-employment rights back to their agency or bureau.

M&E is currently looking for multiple Ukrainian translators to work on contract with us in Grafenwoehr, Germany.

Candidates will be required to work closely with our employees at an American military base.

You will be required to communicate and assist with the translation of English to Ukrainian which will be aimed at providing Soldiers with foreign language skills and cultural awareness whilst supporting training and operations.

Alongside fantastic pay rates we also offer opportunities for training and development.
